intro: Glochidion wonenggau, commonly known as the Kukui tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the island of Guam and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Glochidion wonenggau plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various species. However, it is considered endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species.
